posts.name: elcapitan
posts.cooked: XNspy inform on their webpage that they have possibility to read all Signal content. Does anyone have some experience with this or more detailed information ? Does spy tools like XNspy need to make jailbreak on iOS to do this ?

In that case, Signal could offer an option to block screen capture like they do on Windows for Recall: Secure sensitive activities  |  Fraud prevention  |  Android Developers.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: There‚Äôs already a block screenshot toggle in the settings.
Not sure if it is there under iOS, but on android it‚Äôs in the privacy section, the one with the lock symbol.

Signal Support

Screen Security

Use Screen Security to prevent Signal previews from appearing in the app switcher on your phone. This is unrelated to the screen lock designed to lock your Signal screen so that you can't interact ...

posts.name: Marcos Morar
posts.cooked: On Android, screen security is not enabled by default, unlike on Windows 11, where it is. Many users trust Signal for its security and are unaware they need to enable this feature.

marcos-morar:

On Android, screen security is not enabled by default, unlike on Windows 11, where it is. Many users trust Signal for its security and are unaware they need to enable this feature.

this is not a direct argument for default settings in either direction.

spy program what original poster refers to is a third party spy program and needs to be separately installed, which is not that easy because attacker needs access to a victims device.

in case of windows 11, problem is microsoft and windows themselves. signal is defending from operating system, not third party apps.

posts.name: Marcos Morar
posts.cooked:
On Android, the biggest issue with the operating system is Google, which is widely regarded as a major privacy concern. Users need to protect their chats from eavesdropping by Google.

And as I said before users trust Signal to secure their communications and assume their screen is already protected without needing to manually enable an optional feature. So, the screen protection feature should be enabled by default on Android.

posts.name: elcapitan
posts.cooked: I think this is not a solution against third party spy tools. It can help to lock screen/phone and hide signal from visible apps on first glance but it doesn`t help avoid leaking of data for spy tools like XNspy.

posts.name: Daniel Azuelos
posts.cooked:
XNspy is a software which doesn‚Äôt require a jailbreak from the
target iPhone nor from the spying iPhone. It requires a full access to
the target iPhone screen and then in this way may access to any
communication taking place and which should be of course
displayed on the screen.
But since the child which will give this kind of access to the iPhone
of his parents is aware of the consequences regarding even
fully encrypted communication I think that this is not a real problem.
Anyway, this doesn‚Äôt seem a weakness on the Signal model of security.

If the children is not correctly informed, then this is a security
problem due to bad human communication inside the family.

The same kind of problem which happens when:

  • Bob who is in some confidential defense group,
    lends Alice his unlocked iPhone,
    without taking care Alice is not in these groups,
  • Bob invites Alice to a confidential defense group
    where she should not be.

As another example of false security vulnerability,
when calling the Apple Support, they establish a screen sharing
on your iPhone, and then could read all your Signal
communications.
They are careful to stop the screen sharing when we are typing
a password, but not when we are switching to Signal.

They should be trained to be more careful about customers
privacy levels, from private jokes to defense confidential grade.
posts.edit_reason: A post was merged in by Herohtar

posts.name: Daniel Azuelos
posts.cooked:
I would like to take advantage of this false security problem
inside Signal to ask if a feature would be possible inside Signal
( and for all OSes ).

Would it be possible to detect from Signal if actually the screen
is under remote control? And in such a case give a red warning
to the user:

Your screen is under remote control and not confidential
Is this OK for you?
?

A nice example of such a software ( which detect who is spying us )
I checked and used for a highly confidential environment is OverSight.
